review: My brand new, out of the box Amazon Fire TV came with NO: Netflix, HULU, VUDU, Pandora and no possibility to add them!Only Amazon Prime.On App store only 6 apps available!Called Amazon Support and 1st technician assumed item was defective. Free replacement box arrived in days. Same problem!!!Called Amazon Support and 2nd technician found the problem. Default country on Amazon Prime was set to Europe, when my only address is in the US!?!?!. After changing the Amazon Prime default country to US, the box start working normally.My review, excluding this country-setting problem:First thoughts of the short experience with Amazon:I also have a Roku3, and I have to admit Ruko is much more simple and intuitive. The always presence of Prime on the FireTV is something that if you don't want Prime is reason enough to choose Roku. Ruko comes with MGo movies, but you are able to disable that.The channels available in the Amazon "Cloud" is very, very limited compared to Roku, and a lot of apps are paid.The remote is beautiful and more effective than the Roku one.FireTV has Dolby Digital Plus decoder (the more common sound in Netflix), a great advantage to Roku.Returned and ordered another Roku3 for my home.

author: Lauren Robertson

review: This streaming player is outstanding. The remote is RF so you can hide the box behind your TV. The interface is fast. The voice search works better than I expected. Just hold the mic button on the remote and say "Bradley Cooper" and you instantly see 49 selections. I can't see how it could be easier to find and watch a movie. Prime members have lots of movies and TV episodes available for free. You can set a pin for purchases so you don't accidentally buy something or if you don't want others to buy movies. Apps and games are available. You can even side load android apps not available for purchase through Fire TV (at your own risk of course). We must thank Amazon for that. Kodi will play almost any video.Why did I remove 1 star? There are a few things I could ask for that would require new hardware but I will only ask for one thing that could be fixed right now. AMAZON, PLEASE ENABLE THE USB PORT SO I CAN VIEW/PLAY MY OWN VIDEOS, PICTURES AND MUSIC FROM A USB STICK. With usb storage, this device could be the only device connected to my TV.Update 04/03/2015. The new amazon update now allows usb storage! The usb port even works with a powered usb2 hub. I have the Roswell RHB-330 hub with a usb 120gb SSD (fat32 format) and the Logitech K400 wireless keyboard and a M510 mouse all working together. The only drawback is that the usb storage must be formatted with fat32. For drives up to 2tb, you can use a program called guiformat (google it). Windows will only format fat32 drives up to 32gb.The future Fire TV 2 needs to have more processing power, 4k tv video, HEVC X.265 hardware support, USB3, and a gigabit network port. I'll take 3.
